result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon Scott Van Patter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Brandon Scott Van Patter is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Brandon Scott Van Patter was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

From DE on 2-24-16 requesting to defer Pplan til 4-01-16.  Ret'd call to DE & left a v/m stating he must set up an appt to sign a new Pplan to include his unpd traffic fine or submit a request in writing to defer his Pplan.  DE was advised to call me back ASAP as he has limited time before a WA is issued for non pymt.  Includes 15TR3068, 15CM685. jaf
c: Def, Atty, DA, SCSO & Jail. eif
DE appeared.  DE to pay $100/mo comm 2-15-16.  $15 PPF added.  DE signed PPA. jaf
signed by Def & Atty this date. eif
c: Def & Atty. eif

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes DF ATTY: Joseph Robert Caton DF: Brandon Scott Van Patter appeared out on huber. Case called at 9:08.  Includes 15CM685,15TR3139. ADA Nieskes updates the court.   Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G  to Ct 2 in 15CM685. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 2  in 15CM685. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 1 and 3 in 15CM685. Sentencing arguments. DE makes statement. DE is in a matrix program. Crt orders: 
5 days St. Croix County Jail credit for time served. 
- Costs $625.00
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.

DE to meet with the payment clerk.
Filed by ADA Nieskes. km
filed by Atty. J. Caton. gme
Atty. J. Caton. gme

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Emma P.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

-Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each UA test with an officer of the same sex.

-Engage in mental health treatment.

-Maintain employment.

Further, it is ordered that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis Stats.
Defendant appeared via video conferencing from the St Croix County jail.

CO: SRN, RPR: Vicki Kasten, CLERK: E. Ferrill,  ADA: Matthew L Hartung,  DF ATTY:  Joseph R. Caton,  DF:  Brandon Scott Van Patter appeared from jail via video. Defendant already has a PTC set in January. Defendant is unable to obtain any cash for release.

Bail/bond hearing at 11-18-2015 01:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference at 01-11-2016 08:45 am.

The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ordered that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis Stats.

CO: SRN, RPR: Vicki Kasten, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:   Michael Edward Nieskes,  DF ATTY:  Joseph R. Caton,  DF:  Brandon Scott Van Patter appeared from jail via video. Court confirms address.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Waives speedy trial.  ADA Nieskes requests $500.00 CB, Atty Caton argues.  Defendant is on a PO hold, if hold is released Court will consider a signature bond.  ADA Nieskes states Defendant has warrants out of Florida. State to provide discovery within 20 days and motions within 10 days upon receipt of discovery. Court orders face to face settlement conference before next hearing. Court will defer payments at this time.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 11, 2016 at 08:45 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for November 18, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
